data.text: I was right: when the University of Michigan explains why masks will still be mandated in classrooms, there is no attempt to cite science. Instead this policy is for our "comfort"🤔 https://t.co/c0w7ZGRAH2
@LiliaCortina It's kind of surprising to me, too, after bringing my co2 monitor to my classes. I'm guessing this is about them not being willing to make accommodations for high risk stud. & profs.

@handstateprof @LiliaCortina Science doesn’t exclude nuances or compassion. Requiring masks in classrooms, buses, and medical settings, is consistent with the ADA by providing an equitable and inclusive environment in which high risk faculty AND students can work and study
@LiliaCortina This is about ensuring accessibility to immunocompromised, disabled, & chronically-ill folks who otherwise would not be able to attend classes--or teach in person. #ableism
@LiliaCortina Dropping them 4/14 makes no sense. I’d be pissed at that. And the classrooms on top of it make it all a joke.

@LiliaCortina Without masks there is no emergency, with no emergency there are no emergency powers, with no emergency powers there are no emergency funds.

Masks aren't prevention.
Vaccines aren't treatment. Lockdowns are neither.

Without masks, where are the panic optics?
@LiliaCortina WMU and MSU followed similar path. Again, it seems that many institutions only follow science when it makes sense to them.
@LiliaCortina At Emerson my oldest will no longer have a mask mandate indoors as of 4/11. They will continue to do weekly testing. Her jaw dropped when I told her.
